result.execSummary:
The defendant Ray Noble Jones III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
As To all Counts:
*Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
Court waived all NON-MANDAOTRY costs, fees, and surcharges.
Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision as ordered in case number 16CF5734. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: With Counts 2 & 3, and to any other sentence. With 231 days credit.

*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: With Counts 1 & 3, and to any other sentence. With 231 days credit.
Concurrent with: With Counts 1 & 2, and to any other sentence. With 231 days credit.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ray Noble Jones in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  8 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 231 days credit CONCURRENT to counts 2 & 3, and to any other sentence.

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  231 DAYS at the House of Corrections with 231 days credit CONCURRENT to counts 1 & 3, and to any other sentence.

AS TO COUNT 3: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS at the House of Corrections with 231 days credit CONCURRENT to counts 1 & 2, and to any other sentence.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:

All court MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
Court waived all NON-MANDAOTRY costs, fees, and surcharges.
Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision as ordered in case number 16CF5734. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

20 day appeal rights given

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Ray Noble Jones in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Ray Noble Jones in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, & 3: Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his/her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 30, 2017 at 08:30 am.

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE DONALD FOR JUDGE WITKOWIAK.....
Defendant Ray Noble Jones in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  ADA Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Jury in box at 9:55 AM.
Court instructed jury.  
Closing arguments by state and defense.  
Court charged the jury.  
Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  
Jury retired at the hour of 10:48 AM to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Wegge and Karczewski who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Court received a note from the jury indicating they are deadlocked.

Jury in box at 2:35 PM.
Court read the Allen Instruction to the jury.
Jury out of box at 2:36 PM.

Court received a second note from the jury indicating that they are still deadlocked.

Jury in box at 3:14 PM.
Court examined the jury as to the possibility of reaching a verdict.
Jury advised the Court that they remain deadlocked.
Jury released from service.
Jury out of box at 3:15 PM.

Defense moves for a mistrial.
State takes no position.
Court GRANTS defense motion and "DECLARES" a mistrial.

Court ordered case returned back to Judge Witkowiak's Court.
Case adjourned for Bail/Bond Hearing and Status Conference on 05-31-2016 at 8:30 AM - Br. 22, Judge Witkowiak's Court.
Case scheduled for Jury Trial on 08-15-2016 at 9:00 AM - Br. 22, Judge Witkowiak's Court.
